  5. Republic of Oredsy

‚ÄúSpeak with clarity. Fight with purpose. Live with honor.‚Äù ‚Äî the three foundational principles of Oredsy, taught to every child before formal education begins.

The Republic of Oredsy is the only nation in Criozevan where a sword is simultaneously a weapon, a legal instrument, and a philosophical text. Swordsmanship is not a military specialty ‚Äî it is a civic discipline, taught to every adult by age fourteen and used to settle disputes that range from property boundaries to marriages. The blade is not violence; the blade is clarity made physical.

Capital & Settlements

Oredsy (citizen name: Tharnselda, meaning ‚ÄúSword‚Äôs Choice‚Äù) is built around the central arena Fereltharn (‚ÄúJustice‚Äôs Blade‚Äù), used for duels, referendums, and civic votes. The Tower of Vaelrin houses the Circle Council and archives of national law. Controlled by Pegasus. Southern land trade hub.

Wrofast ‚Äî Port controlling the river-to-sea choke point. Creates ships and maritime tech. All Wrofast ships bear a metallic blue ‚ÄúW‚Äù on the top-right of each sail and the bowsprit tip. Population speaks Sailor Speak.

Imuton ‚Äî Forest town where residents literally live inside enormous tree trunks ‚Äî carved and maintained with the same craft applied to blade-making.

Icogas ‚Äî Ancient magic site beneath the town square. Magic is unstable ‚Äî rumored to be cursed. Holotech and runestones don‚Äôt function here. Secret Butterfly monitoring station. Dark Paladin (#1 Arashi) is located here.

Zhuiburn ‚Äî Surrounded by perpetual flames. Extremely hostile to outsiders. Population speaks Pyrrhith. Lucifer (#6 Arashi) was born here.

Government: The Free Assembly

The Circle ‚Äî High mentors, former champions, and senior arbiters of law.
The Commons ‚Äî Rotating citizen delegates serving fixed terms.
Major decisions may be overturned by popular duel or collective voice-vote in Tharnic.

Selvarin, Master of Swords holds the lifelong title and is elected Voice of the Republic. Known as Kirel‚Äôdra Tharnic (‚ÄúSpeaker of the Sword‚Äôs Truth‚Äù). Mediates national disputes, leads the militia in wartime. His power is equal to Sunlee and Veles.

Pegasus controls or heavily influences all significant political decisions in the Republic ‚Äî the nature of this control is not publicly disclosed.

Military: The Bladeguard

Voluntary but socially expected ‚Äî every adult trained by 14.

  • Road Wards ‚Äî Mounted defenders and scouts
  • Honor Guard ‚Äî Elite duelists and civic protectors
  • Steel Chorus ‚Äî Battlefield signalers trained in rhythm-based Tharnic calls

Officers voted in by their units through ritual declaration. Citizens are Bladewards between campaigns.

Language: Tharnic

Sacred civic language. Key terms: dael (honor/truth), loen (dishonor/challenge), tharn (sword/path/will), kirel (speak/declare), selda (choice/vote), ferel (law/justice).

Sample phrases: ‚ÄúVaela selda dael‚Äù (Freedom is the choice of the honorable). ‚ÄúMorin vaela‚Äù (Remember liberty).
